hacking.notes: used a blind SQL vulnerability to breach the site and gain access to the ESA's database.

confidentiality.notes: Anonymous posted the data in three separate dumps on JustPaste.it, a code-sharing website. One of the files contains names, emails and unencrypted passwords for more than 8,000 users.  Another file includes full names, fax numbers, telephone numbers, addresses, email addresses and organisation names for hundreds of researchers or supporters collaborating with the agency. A third file lists database details and technical information related to web servers.

discovery_notes: Hackers have released thousands of login credentials and other data from the web servers of the European Space Agency (ESA) following a breach of several of the agency's Internet domains earlier in week.
summary: Anonymous has released thousands of login credentials and other data from the web servers of the European Space Agency (ESA) following a breach of several of the agency's Internet domains; did it just to prove it can be done.
